# About the Author  {-}

Taylor Rodgers is a writer, data scientist, and self-publisher. He has written two how-to books related to data science, including *Data Work: A Jargon-Free Guide to Managing Successful Data Teams* and *R Programming in Plain English*, and has plans for several more future releases.

Taylor is an avid R user. He has used R for statistical analysis, machine learning, data visualizations, and Shiny app development. He is a regular contributor to his local R user group in Kansas City. He also occasionally posts R tutorials to a YouTube channel.

Taylor has a masters degree in applied statistics from the University of Kansas Medical Center and a bachelors degree in economics from the University of Kansas.
